remarks: Behavior of transposes in matrix products, see also the statement in [Lang] p. 505.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 9-Jul-2018.)
statement:
mamutpos.f $e |- F = ( R maMul <. M , N , P >. ) $.
mamutpos.g $e |- G = ( R maMul <. P , N , M >. ) $.
mamutpos.b $e |- B = ( Base ` R ) $.
mamutpos.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. CRing ) $.
mamutpos.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. Fin ) $.
mamutpos.n $e |- ( ph -> N e. Fin ) $.
mamutpos.p $e |- ( ph -> P e. Fin ) $.
mamutpos.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. ( B ^m ( M X. N ) ) ) $.
mamutpos.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. ( B ^m ( N X. P ) ) ) $.
mamutpos $p |- ( ph -> tpos ( X F Y ) = ( tpos Y G tpos X ) ) $.
